intro: Rudgea fissistipula, commonly known as the fissile tipped rudgea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals, and are arranged in clusters. Rudgea fissistipula is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
